page.title: 05The Museum.
page.content: The Museum, which is run by the{Sid {Vale Association,}contains a variety of exhibits connected with Sidmouth and the surrounding area. It is located next to Sidmouth's parish church. The reception area contains a{printing press}which was used by the local newspaper, the Sidmouth Herald, from 1831-1969. There is also the only Roman object in East Devon, a{centaur}found on the seafront, together with an impressive collection of{Regency prints}and a room showing local geology. Sidmouth has been the home of many famous people, including {R.E.Delderfield, Alexander Fleming}and {Sir Norman Lockyer. Queen Victoria lived here as a small child. There are various items in the Museum connected with these people. Circa. 11,000 people visit annually.
